alert.note: Alert for DeWitt (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 24 at 6:32AM CST until January 26 at 3:00PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, DeWitt, Gonzales and Karnes. * WHEN...Until 945 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 632 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cuero, Yoakum, Yorktown, Runge, Nordheim, Westhoff, Cheapside, Thomaston, Hochheim, Arneckville, Gruenau, Meyersville, New Davy, Cotton Patch, Concrete, Edgar, Dreyer, Terryville and Choate. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
